meanings.definition: To replenish or supply with new stock.
meanings.sent1: The store is restocking its shelves with fresh products.
meanings.sent2: I need to restock my fridge with groceries.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that he was restocking the pantry to keep the hungry monsters away.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like restocking my soul with joy.
meanings.sent5: The rain was restocking the dry riverbed with life-giving water.

meanings.definition: The act of replenishing or supplying with new stock.
meanings.sent1: The restocking of supplies was done efficiently by the team.
meanings.sent2: We have a restocking schedule to ensure we never run out of products.
meanings.sent3: The sudden restocking of candy in the office caused a sweet commotion.
meanings.sent4: His smile was a restocking of happiness in the room.
meanings.sent5: The restocking of books in the library brought a wave of excitement to the readers.
